definition: to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
loose/to loosen/to relax/floss (dry, fluffy food product made from shredded, seasoned meat or fish, used as a topping or filling)

sentences.english: Encourage her release by constructing an erotic fantasy before things heat up.
sentences.chinese: 应当在高潮激发前鼓励她通过性幻想放松自己。

sentences.english: Feel the body relax, feel the tenseness disappear, but do not fall asleep.
sentences.chinese: 感觉身体放松，感觉绷紧消失，但是不要睡着。

sentences.english: I think I need an ice-cream to chill out.
sentences.chinese: 我想吃支冰淇淋放松一下。

sentences.english: If possible, your back relaxing against the back rest.
sentences.chinese: 如果可以，后背在靠背上放松。

sentences.english: Relaxing foods can enhance your mood and state of mind.
sentences.chinese: 放松食品可以改善你的情绪和精神状态。

sentences.english: It was dusk when the hunter drove into the barn and unhitched his horse.
sentences.chinese: 当猎人驾驶入谷仓并且放松了他的马，它是黄昏。

sentences.english: Try breathing easily and gently tell yourself to relax.
sentences.chinese: 让呼吸平静下来，轻轻告戒自己放松心情。

sentences.english: You don't want to have to think too much. Your job is just to relax and vegetate.
sentences.chinese: 你不想喝太多酒，你只想去放松下，清闲下。

sentences.english: I was so relaxed by my day at the beach, that I fell asleep in the sun.
sentences.chinese: 在阳光普照的海滩上，我放松得睡着了。

sentences.english: Exspecially the swimming pool, how can it be so relaxing?
sentences.chinese: 特别是这个游泳池，气氛怎么可以这么放松呢？

sentences.english: So wonderful and deep relaxing meditation.
sentences.chinese: 如此美妙及深入放松的入静。

sentences.english: Sweat pants, hair tied, chillin with no makeup on.
sentences.chinese: 长运动裤，发带，不化妆的放松。

sentences.english: Quicken work, safety education does not relax.
sentences.chinese: 磨刀不误砍柴功，安全教育不放松。

sentences.english: Because the ideal is not just a tensionless state.
sentences.chinese: 因为理想状态并不只是放松。

sentences.english: This was not what I'd wanted at all and had caught me little off guard to say the least - I'm supposed to be relaxing in my last few days on Hamilton Island.
sentences.chinese: 在汉密尔顿岛的最后几天，我本应该好好放松一下。

sentences.english: Indeed, monetary easing appeared to be costless .
sentences.chinese: 确实，放松货币似乎毫无代价。

definition: to stretch taut/(of muscles etc) taut/strained/tense
to relax/to relax efforts/to slack off/to take it easy/complacent/undisciplined
to ease (tension)/to relax/to cause sth to relax/to alleviate/relaxed/easy and unhurried/leisurely/soothing/mild (slope)
at ease/to feel relieved/to set one's mind at rest/to keep one's mind on sth
to toughen/to temper/to engage in physical exercise/to work out/(fig.) to develop one's skills/to train oneself
to pull back/to shrink/to contract/(physiology) systole
